0.name: Percival's Chat Room
desc: "   You are lounging in a quiet cozy parlor, warmed by a gentle magical fire
which twinkles happily in a warm fireplace.  There are no doors out.  Clearly
the owner of this room needs none.

101.name: The Moor
101.desc: "    A grassy plain darkened by wisps of fog.  The moor stretches northward.

exits.desc: You see a great expanse of misty moor.

102.name: Moor
desc: A dried-out marsh, now barren of all vegetation and covered with a layer
of dust about an inch thick.  You feel a warm breeze. You see a great iron
gate to the north; the moor expands to the south.

exits.desc: You see a great iron gate.
You see a foggy moor.

103.name: Iron Gate
desc: A huge iron gate rusted by years of corrosion has fallen from its hinges.
It appears to be under repair.  A dark entrance lies north and the moor
is to the south.

exits.desc: You see the stone entryway to Canticle.
You see a foggy, misty moor.

104.name: Entryway to Canticle
desc: A foreboding entrance made entirely of perfectly cut granite stone.  An air
of decay and desolation surrounds you.  Maybe you should turn back.

exits.desc: You see a beautiful blue hall.
You see the wrought Iron Gate.

105.name: Blue Hall
desc: A well-decorated passageway colored entirely blue.  The walls appear to
have eyes.  You have the feeling you are being watched.

exits.desc: You see a beautiful hall colored Light Blue.
You see the Hall of the Rooks.
You see a great stone entryway.

106.name: Rook Hall
desc: A small damp hallway filled with eerie noises.  The floor is damp from
moisture which is leaking from the ceiling.

exits.desc: You see the Rook Nook.
You see a blue hall.

107.name: Rook Nook
desc: The southeast corner canticle, the nook is a rather unpleasant place, the
floor worn by the constant pacing of the Rooks, cobwebs brush across your
face as you look around.

exits.desc: You see the Bastille where the Rooks keep their prisoners.
Rook Hall lies to the west.

108.name: Bastille
desc: A damp, dingy prison empty of windows.  A strange unpleasant feeling comes
over you.  You notice that the door has been locked behind you --
you're trapped!!

109.name: Light Blue Hall
desc: A well-decorated passageway colored entirely blue.  The walls appear to
have eyes.  You have the feeling you are being watched.

exits.desc: You see a beautiful blue hall.
You see a hall decorated totally in blue.
You see the Scullery.

110.name: Scullery
desc: A filthy eatery cluttered with dirty pans and plates.  The tables around
the room are warped and faded.  The smell of garlic overpowers you.

exits.desc: The Frump's Den lies to the north.
You see a light blue hall.
You see the Scullery.

111.name: Frump's Den
desc: The Frump's meeting place, a stone lair fallen to decay.  The place is
littered with broken chairs.  It appears that someone lives here.

exits.desc: You see the Scullery.
An Altar Room lies to the west.

112.name: Altar Room
desc: A darkened room with raised structures used for sacrifice.  The floor is
stained blood red and the smell is horrendous.  Mice are everywhere
scampering around.

113.name: Scullery
desc: You're in a storeroom, amidst spices, vegetables, and vast sacks of flour
and other provisions.  The air is thick with spice and garlic.

exits.desc: You see the Scullery.
You see the Jitney.

114.name: The Jitney
desc: A large kitchen filled with boiling caldrons.  A rat scurries across the
floor.  You wonder what's for dinner.  The smell of garlic overpowers you.

115.name: Deep Blue Hall
desc: A well-decorated passageway colored entirely blue.  The faded tapestries
on the walls only hint at the splendor which this hall once had.

exits.desc: You see a dark blue hall.
You see a light blue hall.

116.name: Dark Blue Hall
desc: A well-decorated passageway colored entirely blue.  The walls appear to
have eyes.  You have the feeling you are being watched.

exits.desc: You see a black corridor.
You see a blue cube.
You see a deep blue hall.

117.name: Blue Cube
desc: A perfect cube set in blue, the hair on your neck stands straight as you
feel electricity in the air.  You may want to leave now.

118.name: Black Corridor
desc: A dank, dusty corridor completely void of light.  The walls feel extremely
cold.  From the dust on the floor you can tell no one has walked this way
for a long time.

exits.desc: You see a glass walk.
You see a dark blue hall.

119.name: Glass Walk
desc: The entire room appears made of glass.  Your reflection is distorted.  The
brilliance almost blinds you.

exits.desc: You see a glass walk.
You see a black corridor.
You see a glass walk.

120.name: Glass Walk
desc: The entire room appears made of glass.  Your reflection is distorted.  The
brilliance almost blinds you.

exits.desc: You see a crystal parapet.
You see a glass walk.

121.name: Crystal Parapet
desc: A crystal wall built to protect the soldiers has been damaged by many wars
but stands firm.  From here you can see the surrounding forest.

exits.desc: You see a glass walk.
You see the upper parapet.

122.name: Upper Parapet
desc: A lofty perch on the wall, you become woosy as you realize your altitude.
Over the wall you see a beautiful view.

exits.desc: You see the rampart.
You see a crystal parapet.

123.name: Rampart
desc: A battlement high up on Canticle's walls.  It has been used for centuries of
holy wars.  From here you can survey the entire countryside.

124.name: Glass Walk
desc: The entire room appears made of glass.  Your reflection is distorted.  The
brilliance almost blinds you.

exits.desc: You see the glass walk.
You see a large library.
You see a room of mirrors.

125.name: Edificant Library
desc: The libraries collection of books, parchments, and artifacts fill the
entire room.  Most of the books are on potions and spell casting.

126.name: Mirror Room
desc: The entire room is encased in mirrors.  As you gaze around, you see
yourself reflected a hundred times or more.  The magic mirror hangs on
the south wall.

exits.desc: You see the glass walk.
You think you might be able to enter this magical mirror.

127.name: In The Mirror
desc: You have a strange distored feeling.  You are inside a rainbow of mirrors,
and you wonder which one is the real you.

exits.desc: You see a room full of mirrors.
You see the bottom of staircase.

128.name: Bottom of Staircase
desc: A circular flowing granite staircase ascends the walls and leads into ominous
darkness.  The skeletons of dead adventurers lie strewn about.  Behind you
is a beautiful magic mirror.

exits.desc: You think you might be able to enter this magical mirror.
You see the entrance to the Keep.

129.name: Entrance to the Keep
desc: A strange foyer with satanistic carvings on the wall.  The floor creaks
beneath your feet.  Strange noises and flashes of light come from the door
to the south.

exits.desc: You see the Keep.
You see the bottom of staircase.

130.name: The Keep
desc: The Keep of Canticle, home of the Dark Overlord.  A huge throne room filled
with the odor of sulphur.  The floor is made of silver tile laid perfectly
in the shape of a dragon.  The heat is too much and the sweat drips off
your brow.  You see a huge wooden doorway to the north.
